FuncDef: The bridge-priority command is used to populate the priority portion of the bridge ID field within outbound BPDUs (the most significant 4 bits of the bridge ID). It is also used as part of the decision process when determining the best BPDU between messages received and sent. All values will be truncated to multiples of 4096, conforming with IEEE 802.1t and 802.1D-2004.

ParaDef.Info: The bridge priority for the STP instance. Values-Allowed values are integers in the range of 4096 to 65535 with 4096 being the highest priority. The actual bridge priority value stored/used is the number entered with the lowest 12 bits masked off which means the actual range of values is 4096 to 61440 in increments of 4096..

ExtraInfo: Default: By default, the bridge priority is configured to 4096 which is the highest priority.
